abstract: Spencer C. Barasch, who was said to have hindered federal investigations of fraud at the Stanford Financial Group and later represented the firm, reached a $50,000 civil settlement.
snippet: Spencer C. Barasch, who was said to have hindered federal investigations of fraud at the Stanford Financial Group and later represented the firm, reached a $50,000 civil settlement.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A former enforcement official for the Securities and Exchange Commission who was accused of blocking or closing at least three investigations into the activities of the Stanford Financial Group, which the authorities claim was a $7 billion Ponzi scheme, has settled civil charges brought by the Justice Department accusing him of violating conflict-of-interest rules by later representing Stanford before the commission.

headline.main: Ex-Official at S.E.C. Settles Case for $50,000
headline.print_headline: Ex-Official At S.E.C. Settles Case For $50,000
